comments.commentBody: more.....because, how could there ever be enough?
I lost the love of my life at 51 and couldn't agree more.
He'll never find a woman to match the one he's married to now.

If all the contacts with various Russian people by the Trump organization were so innocent, why has Trump repeatedly contradicted himself with meetings and talks with Putin?  Why did Sessions commit perjury?  Why are Trump associates lying about conversations, meetings or have foggy memories of any form of contacts with the Russians?  The information that the press is unearthing has all the hallmarks of a cover-up.

Gail,
I do understand your desire not to spend spring in an argument about whether Bill Clinton or Jeff Sessions is the bigger liar, but the issue is a matter of degree. Mr. Clinton lied about his relationship with a consenting adult while Mr. Sessions lied about his contact with the Russian ambassador while Russia has been on a campaign to interfere with the election and destabilize Europe. Mr. Sessions wins hands down.

As for what to do with Mr. Sessions, I vote for C. Fire him and put a special prosecutor to work to torture him with subpoenas and depositions as it is becoming clear that the Trump campaign committed treason by meeting with the agents of a hostile foreign government when they had no official standing to do so.

Bottom line here....two things.

North Korea is not yet our problem. It is the problem of countries near it like Russia, China, Japan, South Korea etc. We should only be concerned with it when/if they are about to get long range nuclear weapons that can threaten us, then we give them the ultimatum that Kennedy gave the USSR.....AND

In order to get good intelligence on North Korea, have the Republicans in Congress do something about the incompetent now in our WH and restore our intelligence community to best in the world instead of being an arm of Putin and Russia now.
typo on one of my posts...should read NOT nuke..

One final word re the good people who disagreed with my post.

If So Korea or Japan had any guts re their defense and not act in a wimpy why hiding behind America's military shield that should put China on notice that if they don't defang their puppet North Korea re nukes, that they will both start a limited nuclear program to counter No Korea.

That will scare the heck out of China and give them impetus to de nuke North Korea...

Paul:

Both S. Korea and Japan have substantively agreed to sublimate their military to American hegemony.

The U.S. is at the center, the hub of a vast, parallel hub and spoke economic and security system that we created after WWII in part, as a response to the cold war.

Like it or not, we made a deal with the NATO countries in Europe, Japan and South Korea in Asia and Australia and New Zealand in the South Pacific. Essentially, economically we gave away access to our very rich markets in exchange for geopolitical hegemony over this vast alliance. Many of these nations, regions, protected their own economies even while they were dumping vast tons of trade into the U.S. The U.S. policy makers figured that because the U.S. was more advanced and competitive, it could give up some ground to these countries in more traditional sectors in exchange for penetration in advance sectors. Some times this hurt, as with autos with Japan and S. Korea, some times it worked out well, as in the 1990s and the export of computers and software. NATO and the other alliances basically put the militaries of the 25 of the 30 or so richest countries of the world's military at our disposal for the almost token price of reasonable/rational diplomacy. NATO makes its members supremely secure and that in turn has facilitate trade and prosperity for most members.

Unfortunately this model began to be undermined by the Neocons in the BushJr administration & so has begun to unravel. Now comes Trump.
The destruction of N. korea's missile and nuclear capacity even if military action is repeatedly required. Hopefully,, this may also result in the overthrow of the government.
Force him to wear a ruffled shirt and bow tie at every time he has a news conference.
What other outcomes can we see coming forth from the Trump administration?  After all the "deplorables" are in the White House.
We lost Molly Ivins but at least we still have Gail Collins.

AHA! So, if Sessions said nothing about meeting with Russians, that would be “lying by omission,” whereas volunteering, without being asked, that he did not meet with Russians is “consciousness of guilt.” I get it!

It’s like all these guys have a PhD in Nuanced Lying, which they obtained after their Master’s Degree in Flat Out Lying.

Now I have a question: What if Sessions said something like: “They’re lying if they say I met with Russians because I’m certain nobody saw me.” Is there a term for that? I’d like to know because somewhere along the way I’m sure we’re going to get that one.

@Michjas
Your point is important. The attorney general will need to decide whether an accused acts with negligence or criminal intent; e.g., misspeaking or lying. Sessions is hopelessly compromised in that regard.

Is there anyone in the Trump family or administration who did NOT have relations with Russia?

It's ironic that if Sanders had won the nomination, the GOP and Trump would have painted him as a commie, socialist, Russia-lover. Of course now we know that Trump and the GOP project their failings onto the "enemy" all the time. If the GOP and Trump say one thing ("I did not have relations with that country!) then the opposite is true.
Most Republicans are just fine with having their drinking water polluted.  These aren't the sharpest tools in the shed.
Sessions is Trump's toady.  Schooled in the art of saying lies and terrible things with a lilt in his voice and a smile on his face.  Any questions?
Someone in Cleveland told me he plans to repeal the abolition of slavery and replace it with something even better. I think we should probably just get rid of him.
I've wondered, during the hearings, how many of the trump administration cabinet members lied during questioning by congress.  Easy to do and trump doesn't seem to mind.
He lied under oath. He should be impeached if he won't do the honorable thing and resign.

G.H. war was declared on liberalism perhaps not by you, but by many conservatives, a long time ago.  Every trick in the book and quite of few not written anywhere, were used to stymie our last President.  It seems childish to criticize those for fighting fire with fire.

Hope it doesn't take too long to expose Trump and his corporate cronies cosy relationship with the Russians. We need clean air, public schools, national health and freedom of speech. And we need Trump and a lot nasty Republicans out of office.
Perfect suggestion. Bronzed would be good - he looks pretty stiff already.
For any of his colleagues to say Sessions is a likable guy betrays an inability to judge a man  by the content of his character (MLKJr).  This has become a defining problem for Americans today.
Hey, give him credit for not liking Ted Cruz.
There lied Jeff Sessions, remembered always for his false testimony to Congress and the American people to secure his last job, so help me God.

Seb, the problem is that many voters, especially the black and Hispanic voters needed to defeat Republicans, don't bother to show up when the presidency isn't on the ballot. Maybe 2018 will be different, and the House can be flipped, but I'm skeptical. We may need to wait for 2020, and by then Trump may postpone elections "temporarily" because he heard about massive fraud.

Who's going to stop him?

Of course, any contact with a Russian is the same.

Me talking to my Russian buddy at the gym and top campaign officials speaking with Russian officials during a hacking scandal are the same thing.

Russian/Trump apologists have to do better than this. It sounds foolish.

This is like watching a never ending comedy, except the players think they are real! I confess that I do not understand the legal term "perjury", but I can recognize a liar when I hear him. And Sessions is a liar. That is so banal that it's not worth discussing. However, why he lied is. What was he covering up and why? Why would a sitting AG think it necessary to steer the media and the people away from the truth? I submit that I don't know, and maybe I never will. But, the less I know, the more I speculate about what I don't know. The ball is in their court!
